channel.title: PSP - Good news:
channel.description:
Here is article written on March 15th that I found:
Sony, makers of the wildly popular PSP portable entertainment centers, have announced the development of the PSP-290, which will sport GPS functionality, and the PSP-300, which will have a camera feature called EyeToy and a video and VoIP chat service. Both of these devices should be available for purchase later this year. [b]Also in the future for the PSP will be the ability to see images created with Macromedia Flash and an RSS feed, for download of both audio and video from Internet sources.[/b] The true icing on the cake, however, is the announcement that the PSP retail price will drop to US$199 by April 1. To bad these new features won't be part of the new low-cost model.
I am so excited that macromedia flash will be supported :D Only a matter of time until Java will work on it.

item.title: PSP - Good news:
item.dc:creator: @nohope nohope
item.description:
@nohope wrote:

I have the white psp, I got it for christmas. I am looking at it now. I just can’t find the charger. How much is this PSP? I don’t think it came out. I’m not up to date with this techinal stuff. I’ll buy it if anybody has any word on where to buy it and what it say’s on the box to help me find it.

Read full topic

moparisthebest:

also breaking news, you will be able to hack into military databases and launch nuclear bombs at your country of choice with the new PSP!!!!!111!!ONE11!!!!!

jme_009:

Lol, well I am a psp "fanboi", I have been waiting for this for a while. Now I can go watch newgrounds movies at school

I was considering buying PSP ($100 saved so far). Now I'm confused..Should I wait for the new one to come out or what?

@jme wrote:

Here is article written on March 15th that I found:

Sony, makers of the wildly popular PSP portable entertainment centers, have announced the development of the PSP-290, which will sport GPS functionality, and the PSP-300, which will have a camera feature called EyeToy and a video and VoIP chat service. Both of these devices should be available for purchase later this year.

Also in the future for the PSP will be the ability to see images created with Macromedia Flash and an RSS feed, for download of both audio and video from Internet sources.

The true icing on the cake, however, is the announcement that the PSP retail price will drop to US$199 by April 1. To bad these new features won't be part of the new low-cost model.

I am so excited that macromedia flash will be supported Only a matter of time until Java will work on it.
